intro: Brachyandra, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, often blue or purple, composite flowers. Brachyandra species typically have hairy foliage and are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. They are popular in native gardens for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
